{{Infobox television | show_name = The Dovekeepers | image = | alt = | caption = | genre = [[Biblical]]
[[Historical Drama]] | runtime = 180 minutes | creator = | based_on = The book ''[[The Dovekeepers (novel)|The Dovekeepers]]'' by [[Alice Hoffman]] | composer = [[Jeff Beal]] | opentheme = | director = [[Yves Simoneau]] | writer = Ann Peacock (teleplay) | executive_producer = [[Roma Downey]]
[[Mark Burnett]]
John Weber
Frank Siracusa
[[Yves Simoneau]] | producer = [[Alice Hoffman]] | starring = [[Cote de Pablo]]
[[Rachel Brosnahan]]
[[Sam Neill]] | cinematography = [[Guy Dufaux]] | editor = Sylvain Lebel
Isabelle Malenfant | company = Take 5 Productions
Whiz Bang Films
[[Lightworkers Media]] | distributor = [[CBS Television Studios]] | network = [[CBS]] | first_aired = {{Start date|2015|03|31}} | last_aired = {{End date|2015|04|01}} | country = United States | language = English | location = [[Malta]] | num_seasons = | num_episodes = | list_episodes = | website = http://www.cbs.com/shows/the-dovekeepers | website_title = | related = ''[[Masada (miniseries)|Masada]]'' | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''The Dovekeepers''''' is a two-part television adaptation based on the book of the same name by [[Alice Hoffman]] from executive producers [[Roma Downey]] and [[Mark Burnett]]. It features the [[Siege of Masada]] by troops of the Roman Empire towards the end of the First Jewishâ€“Roman War.{{cite web|url=http://alicehoffman.com/books/the-dovekeepers/synopsis/|title=The Dovekeepers: Synopsis|publisher=Alice Hoffman|accessdate=4 April 2015}} The program premiered in the United States on March 31, 2015 on [[CBS]].{{cite web|url=http://www.cbs.com/shows/the-dovekeepers/about/|title=The Dovekeepers|publisher=CBS|accessdate=4 April 2015}} ==Plot== According to the official [[trailer (film)|trailer]], {{cquote|From the producers of ''[[The Bible (TV series)|The Bible]]'', comes the story of a place called Masada, where three extraordinary women faced an army of thousands. A healer accused of witchcraft. An outcast haunted by her past. A woman with the heart of a warrior.|}} '''Tagline:''' The trailer featured the tagline, "Their journey. Their passion. It all leads up to this. Take a stand." ==Main cast== *[[Cote de Pablo]] as Shirah *[[Rachel Brosnahan]] as Yael *[[Kathryn Prescott]] as Aziza *[[Sam Neill]] as [[Josephus|Flavius Josephus]] *[[Diego Boneta]] as Amram *[[Mido Hamada]] as [[Eleazer Ben Ya'ir]] *[[Sam Hazeldine]] as [[Lucius Flavius Silva|Flavius Silva]] *[[Jonas Armstrong]] as Yoav *[[Luke Roberts (actor)|Luke Roberts]] as Jachim Ben Simon *[[Fiona O'Shaughnessy]] as Channa *Kenneth Spiteri as Claudius *Diarmaid Murtagh as Wynn *Manuel Cauchi as Josef Bar Elhanan *Andre Agius as Adir ==Episodes== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="width:100%; background:#fff; margin:auto;" |- !style="background:#B30713; width:5%;"|Ep. # !style="background:#B30713; width:20%;"|Title !style="background:#B30713; width:20%;"|Original airdate !style="background:#B30713; width:10%;"|Viewers
(million) {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber= 1.1 |Title= Part 1 |OriginalAirDate= {{start date|2015|03|31}} |Viewers= 8.99http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2015/04/01/tv-ratings-tuesday-weird-loners-the-dovekeepers-start-soft-marvels-agents-of-s-h-i-e-l-d-new-girl-hit-lows-the-flash-izombie-flat/382572/ |ShortSummary=Roman historian Flavius Josephus chronicles the lives of three Jewish women during the Romans' siege of Masada in A.D. 73, where more than 900 Jews were able to take refuge at the fortress for months. But first he pressures two of them into telling their versions of the story; Shirah, believed to be the witch of Moab, and Yael, an outcast to her father and neighbors. In order to tell the story, they must first go back to the beginning and share accounts of their pasts. |LineColor=B30713 }} {{Episode list |EpisodeNumber= 1.2 |Title= Part 2 |OriginalAirDate= {{start date|2015|04|01}} |Viewers=6.40http://deadline.com/2015/04/dovekeepers-ratings-down-american-idol-blackish-lmodern-family-abc-1201403344/ |ShortSummary=Shirah and Yael remain in the custody of Flavius Josephus in his house in Rome. They tell of how Shirah's warrior daughter, Aziza joins them in their duty of keepers of the messenger doves in their home. Roman centurions Flavius Silva and Claudius devise a plan in how to get their soldiers into Masada. But to the Jewish [[sicarii]], it's "freedom or death" as they hole up in the last Jewish fortress in [[Judea]] before the fateful day of the siege. |LineColor=B30713 }} |} ==Reception== The adaptation garnered negative reviews: Keith Uhlich of the ''[[Hollywood Reporter]]'' writes, "True to its title, this romantic-historical miniseries is more fowl than fair. CBS' two-part adaptation of Alice Hoffman's best-selling novel is a cheap, chintzy adventure." While, Brian Lowry of ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' writes, "Designed to play as a moving adaptation of Alice Hoffman's bestseller, ''The Dovekeepers'' is more of a wounded duck."http://variety.com/t/the-dovekeepers/ ==See also== * ''[[The Dovekeepers (novel)]]'' * ''[[Masada (miniseries)|Masada]]'', a 1981 television dramatization of the events at Masada ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.cbs.com/shows/the-dovekeepers}} * {{IMDb title|tt3656138|The Dovekeepers}} * {{TV Guide|678037}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dovekeepers, The}} [[Category:American television films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:2010s American television series]] [[Category:English-language television programming]] [[Category:Television series based on actual events]] [[Category:Television series by CBS Television Studios]] [[Category:Television series by MGM Television]]
